It includes the transportation, storage, and delivery of raw materials from suppliers to the manufacturing plant or warehouse. Inbound logistics is a crucial component of the overall supply chain as it directly impacts the efficiency and cost of production.The importance of inbound logistics in the cost of production can be seen in several key areas:1.Cost Efficiency: Properly managed inbound logistics can help reduce transportation and storage costs, leading to lower production costs.
